0.title: Russia bans Joe Biden, other top US officials from entering its soil
0.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry said that US President Joe Biden and other top officials have been banned from entering the country in a reciprocal response to US sanctions. The measure, which also applies to Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, "is the consequence of the extremely Russophobic policy pursued by the current US administration," said Russia.

1.title: Paytm share price drops 71% from IPO price; out of BSE top-100 mcap list
1.article_body: Paytm shares dropped to an all-time low of ₹616.55 apiece on Tuesday, leading it to drop out of the BSE top 100-most valued companies by market capitalisation. Following RBI's order on Paytm Payments Bank, its shares crashed 20% in the last two trading sessions. Notably, its share price has dropped 71% from its issue price of ₹2,150 apiece.

2.title: Amazon's demand for $200 mn caused Amazon-Future settlement talks to fail: Report
2.article_body: The dispute settlement talks between Amazon and India's Future Retail failed over the US company's demand for the return of at least $200 million it had invested in Future, Reuters reported. Future instead offered a stake of an equivalent amount in one of its remaining group companies after Reliance takes over most of its retail assets. Amazon didn't accept that.

3.title: Bobby was nervous about speaking Haryanvi in 'Love Hostel': Shanker
3.article_body: 'Love Hostel' director Shanker Raman revealed Bobby Deol was nervous about speaking Haryanvi in the film. Shanker said Bobby started working on it a month before the film's shooting began and added the actor completely surrendered himself. "We would have dinner on location...he would just say his lines to me, like a child, happy to have learned them," Shanker stated.

4.title: SoftBank's Munish Varma steps down from Paytm, PolicyBazaar boards
4.article_body: Paytm on Tuesday informed stock exchanges that Munish Varma, Managing Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers, has resigned from Paytm's board "due to personal commitments and other pre-occupations". He has also resigned from Policybazaar's board. Varma's resignation is consistent with Softbank's move globally, as it steps away from board positions after its portfolio companies get listed.

5.title: Better to touch it than never being world no. 1: Daniil on losing top spot
5.article_body: Daniil Medvedev, who will lose his world number one ranking to Novak Djokovic on Monday, said it's better to be number one for "one week in life" than to never "touch" it. Medvedev claimed the top spot on February 28. The Russian lost the ranking after losing to Frenchman Gael Monfils in Indian Wells Masters third round on Monday.

6.title: Will be with family for a while: Sandra on taking break from acting
6.article_body: Actress Sandra Bullock said she will be taking a break from acting "for a while" to focus on her family. Adding that it's 24/7 work, Sandra said that she takes her job as an actor very seriously when she's at work. "I just want to be 24/7 with my babies..my family...That's where I'm gonna be for a while," she added.

7.title: Pakistan logs 473 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hours
7.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 473 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 4 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to 30,313. NCOC added that out of 18,026 active cases, 560 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 1.37% from 1.48%.

8.title: Myanmar's military has committed crimes against humanity: UN
8.article_body: Myanmar's military has committed war crimes and crimes against humanity since it took power in a coup, the UN said. Security forces have shown a flagrant disregard for human life, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Michelle Bachelet, said. Many victims were shot in the head, burned to death, arrested arbitrarily, tortured, or used as human shields, she added.

9.title: Frankfurt Airport cancels 130 flights amid strike by security staff
9.article_body: Authorities at Germany's Frankfurt Airport cancelled 130 out of 818 flights on Tuesday as airport's cargo and passenger control employees went on strike. This comes amid wage dispute between Verdi trade union and Federal Association of Aviation Security Companies (BDLS). While trade union raised host of demands including an hourly raise of at least €1, BDLS has refused to comply.

10.title: BJP-BSP had tacit understanding on 122 seats in UP polls: SBSP chief
10.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) founder OP Rajbhar on Tuesday claimed that the BJP and Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) had a tacit understanding on 122 Assembly seats in UP. "122 seats in Purvanchal are such on which candidates were decided at BJP office and symbols were given at BSP office. I can provide evidence for the same," he alleged.

11.title: In worst debt of my life, anyone else in my place would've died by suicide: Kaaranvir
11.article_body: TV actor Kaaranvir Bohra has said that he is currently under "the worst debt" of his life, adding, "I have at least three-four cases on me for not paying the money back." He added, "Since 2015, whatever work I accept is to pay off the debt...Had anyone else been in my position, he would've died by suicide," said Bohra.

12.title: Meta fined $19 million by Ireland over a series of data breaches
12.article_body: Irish watchdog has imposed €17 million ($19 million) fine on Meta Platforms for failing to prevent a series of 12 personal data breaches on Facebook in 2018. "We found that Meta Platforms failed to have in place appropriate technical and organisational measures," the Data Protection Commission (DPC) said. "This fine isn't about a failure to protect people's information," Meta said.

13.title: Delhi Metro to start services after 2.30 pm on Holi, buses to run after 2 pm
13.article_body: Delhi Metro services won't be available till 2:30 pm on all lines, including the Airport Express Line, on Holi this Friday, the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said. Services will start at 2:30 pm from terminal stations on all lines and will continue normally thereafter, it added. DTC bus services will also start after 2 pm on Holi.

14.title: Ukraine realises it can't join NATO, says President Zelenskyy
14.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said the country realises that it can't join NATO. Speaking  to representatives of the UK-led Joint Expeditionary Force (JEF), Zelenskyy said that "we heard for years about the allegedly open doors" of NATO, but "we have already heard that we won't be able to join". He added that "it's the truth we must recognise".

15.title: Whenever I DM him, I get a reply: Pune engineer who is Twitter friends with Musk
15.article_body: A 23-year-old engineer from Pune, who is Twitter friends with the world's richest man Elon Musk said that they converse on various subjects and Musk is very "straightforward". Pranay Pathole added, "He's super friendly. It doesn't feel like you are interacting with the world's richest person...He's very active on Twitter...because whenever I DM him, I get a reply within...minutes."

16.title: Udupi schools & colleges to reopen tomorrow, section 144 to continue
16.article_body: Schools and colleges in Karnataka's Udupi will reopen on Wednesday after being shut on Tuesday in view of the HC's judgment on the hijab ban issue. However, prohibitory orders imposed under CrPC section 144 will continue till March 21, banning processions, celebrations and protests, the Deputy Commissioner said. The HC upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

17.title: 2,000 civilian cars left besieged Mariupol: Ukrainian officials
17.article_body: Around 2,000 civilian cars have been able to leave the besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol along a humanitarian evacuation route, the city council said on Tuesday. A further 2,000 vehicles were waiting to leave the city, it added. The Russian forces have blockaded and bombarded Mariupol, with supplies in the city running low.

18.title: K'taka hijab case petitioners vow to attend classes only in hijab
18.article_body: Girls who are seeking permission to wear hijab inside educational institutions vowed to "fight for justice and [their] rights" and attend classes only in hijab. "The Constitution itself provides us (our rights) to follow my religion and wear whatever we want," one of the girls said. Karnataka HC today held prescription of uniform as a reasonable restriction.

19.title: Oppn's lack of cooperation led to BJP's win in Assembly polls: Alagiri
19.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) chief KS Alagiri on Monday said the BJP won Assembly polls in four states due to lack of cooperation among opposition parties. "To defeat...BJP and PM Modi [in 2024 Lok Sabha elections] opposition...should start working together from today," he added. Alagiri added that Congress cadres across the country want Rahul Gandhi to lead the party.

20.title: Man fakes religious identity, rapes 19-yr-old & films act in J'khand
20.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested on the charge of raping a 19-year-old a month back and for filming the act to blackmail her in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district, a police officer said on Tuesday. The victim, in her complaint, said that the accused had allegedly faked his religious identity and befriended her some time ago.

21.title: Woman who held 'No war' poster on Russian TV on trial, faces 10 days in prison
21.article_body: Marina Ovsyannikova, the woman who interrupted a live news bulletin on Russian state TV channel with a 'No war' poster, is on trial and faces ten days in prison, said AFP. She was detained after she ran on to set holding the sign. Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron said he'd discuss offering protection for her with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.

22.title: MEA did commendable job: Cong MP on evacuation from war-hit Ukraine
22.article_body: Congress MP Anand Sharma praised the Ministry of External Affairs for evacuating Indians from war-hit Ukraine. "Work done by the MEA, diplomats, and Indian Missions abroad is commendable," he said. He also narrated an incident regarding one student and said he contacted Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla at 1:00 am for help and received a response at 1:22 am.

23.title: His 1st reply was my life's highlight: Pune engineer on being Twitter friends with Musk
23.article_body: A 23-year-old Pune engineer revealed how he became friends with world's richest man and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter. In 2018, then 2nd year engineering student Pranay Pathole tweeted to Musk about Tesla's automatic screen wipers, to which Musk responded instantly. Adding that their interactions are casual now, Pathole said Musk's first response was the "highlight" of his life.

24.title: Australian govt’s 'Women’s Network' withdraws logo over criticism
24.article_body: Women's Network, a volunteer-based collective in the Australian Prime Minister's department, has withdrawn its logo after receiving criticism over it. The logo consisted of a cursive W with a domed protrusion, giving it an apparent resemblance to male genitalia. The group clarified that the "Prime Minister's office wasn't part of this logo design".

25.title: Expect to evacuate our citizens from Ukraine's Mariupol soon: Turkey
25.article_body: Turkey's Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu said on Tuesday that the country expects to evacuate its citizens from Ukraine's Mariupol soon. He added that 14,800 Turkish citizens had been evacuated from Ukraine so far amid the Russian invasion. Çavuşoğlu's comments came after Russian forces attacked a mosque in Mariupol last week where over 80 people, including Turkish citizens, had sought refuge.

26.title: ₹7.34 lakh crore recovered by banks since FY16: MoS Finance
26.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad on Tuesday said banks have recovered ₹7,34,542 crore in the last six financial years and in the first six months of FY22. This includes recoveries in cases of non-performing assets and written-off loan accounts. He added that systematic and comprehensive checking led to unearthing of frauds perpetrated over the years.

27.title: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in Apr-Jun 2021 amid 2nd wave
27.article_body: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in April-June 2021 from 9.3% in the previous quarter amid COVID-19's second wave, according to data released by the government. The rise in unemployment in the second quarter of 2021 was the first such increase since the jobless rate peaked at 20.8% in April-June 2020, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said.

28.title: Beating Federer at 2014 Davis Cup final was a big moment: Monfils
28.article_body: World number 28 Gael Monfils said that defeating 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer at Davis Cup final in 2014 was a "big moment" for him. "It was an important match," he added. Monfils beat Federer in second match and levelled the tie 1-1. However, Switzerland won the next two matches to win their first-ever Davis Cup title.

29.title: Marshals, throw him out: Rajasthan Speaker evicts MLA from Assembly
29.article_body: Rajasthan MLA Sanyam Lodha was evicted from state Assembly by Speaker CP Joshi on Tuesday after he disrupted proceedings of the House. "Marshals, throw him out. I'll not allow it," Joshi ordered. Lodha, who was demanding the release of a man jailed for four years on a murder charge, entered the Well of the House and raised slogans against police.

30.title: Didn't realise I was pregnant for 2.5 months: Comedian Bharti Singh
30.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said she didn't realise that she was pregnant for the first two and a half months. She jokingly added, "Mote logo ka pata nahi chalta." Bharti revealed she and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa were surprised when they found out about the pregnancy. "We didn't plan that this is the right time to have a baby," she stated.

31.title: Swara Bhasker indirectly targets 'The Kashmir Files' in her tweet, Twitter users react
31.article_body: Swara Bhasker's tweet, wherein she seemed to indirectly speak about Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', sparked reactions on Twitter. "People are asking why prominent Bollywood stars haven't said a word of appreciation for getting people back in cinemas. Operative word being 'prominent'," a comment read. Another Twitter user agreed to her tweet and commented, "Well said."

32.title: Cong heads of 5 states asked to resign post-Assembly poll defeat
32.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday asked the party's state heads of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Goa and Manipur to resign from their posts. This is being done to reorganise the Pradesh Congress Committees of these states. Congress won only two of 403 seats in UP, 19 of 70 seats in Uttarakhand and 18 of 117 seats in Punjab.

33.title: Alibaba, Tencent lose over $1 trillion in market value over a year
33.article_body: Chinese technology giants Alibaba and Tencent have lost more than $1 trillion in combined market value over the last 13 months. The stocks of Chinese tech companies plunged over the past year as the government extended its regulatory crackdown. While food delivery platform Meituan's market value has plunged by $254.6 billion since February 2021, e-commerce platform Pinduoduo lost $217.6 billion.

34.title: Unseen hands at work to engineer unrest: K'taka HC on hijab case
34.article_body: As it passed the verdict on the hijab controversy on Tuesday, a three-judge bench of the Karnataka High Court commented that some "unseen hands are at work to engineer social unrest and disharmony". "We are dismayed as to how all of a sudden...the issue of hijab is generated and blown out of proportion by the powers that be," HC said.

35.title: Actor Puneeth's elder brothers break down at 'James' event
35.article_body: Puneeth Rajkumar's elder brothers Raghavendra Rajkumar and Shivarajkumar got emotional while remembering the late actor during an event for Puneeth's film 'James'. "I can't tolerate [Puneeth's death] anymore, I'm ready to leave," Raghavendra said. Shivarajkumar broke down listening to Raghavendra and said, "It pained me a lot to see [Raghavendra] speak like that...[Puneeth] was everyone's pet."

36.title: EU to propose 'amber' category for gas, nuclear energy investments
36.article_body: EU chief advisor Nathan Fabian on Tuesday said bloc will shortly propose a new category 'amber' for not-fully green investments such as gas, nuclear energy. This comes after Fabian had opposed including both as green investments. Notably, gas, nuclear energy play a role in transition towards green fuel as they are low-carbon but produce greenhouse gases and radioactive waste respectively.

37.title: Ukraine's region warns of air raids, urges citizens to take shelter
37.article_body: Authorities in Ukrainian region of Chernihiv on Tuesday issued a nationwide warning of air raids by Russian forces. They also urged the citizens to take shelter. However, it was not clear if other regions in the country had issued similar warnings. Meanwhile, UN said at least 636 civilians were killed in Ukraine from February 24 to March 13.

38.title: New Zealand's new policy offers visas to 4,000 Ukrainian refugees
38.article_body: New Zealand on Tuesday said that it will offer 4,000 special visas to family members of Ukrainian-New Zealanders under a new policy in a response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. It's New Zealand's largest special visa category in decades, Immigration Minister Kris Faafoi said. Nearly 30 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the invasion began in February, the UN said.

39.title: HC asks Sharad Yadav to vacate govt bungalow in Delhi in 15 days
39.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday asked former JD(U) chief Sharad Yadav to vacate the government bungalow occupied by him within 15 days as he was disqualified as Rajya Sabha MP in 2017. The court said there was no justification for Yadav to retain the bungalow. Yadav was elected to the Rajya Sabha in 2017.

40.title: Zomato loans $150 mn to Blinkit, buys 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 mn
40.article_body: Zomato is loaning $150 million to Blinkit (formerly Grofers) as per its plan of investing $400 million cash in Indian quick commerce over the next two years. The loan's interest rate will be 12% p.a. or higher with a tenor of not more than one year. Zomato is also acquiring a 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 million.

41.title: Deep Ocean Mission will bolster observations in Indian Ocean: Centre
41.article_body: Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary M Ravichandran on Monday said Deep Ocean Mission will strengthen observational network in Indian Ocean. He added the system will help capture long term changes in the ocean's climatic conditions. Reportedly, eight deep ocean gliders, 48 argo floats and 150 wave drifters will be added in coming years as part of the ₹4,000 crore mission.

42.title: Over 13,500 Russian troops killed since war began: Ukraine
42.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said over 13,500 Russian troops were killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. The ministry added that 404 tanks, 81 aircraft and 95 helicopters belonging to Russian forces were destroyed so far. Meanwhile, UN said at least 636 civilians including 46 children were killed from February 24 to March 13 in Ukraine.

43.title: Amazon's ad campaign laughable, attempt to confuse Indian govt: CAIT
43.article_body: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said it finds Amazon's claims in a paid public advertisement "sanctimonious and laughable". "They are nothing but a pathetic attempt at buying media legitimacy and confusing the Indian government...about Amazon's persistent violations of India's FDI laws," it added. The traders' body further said the contents of the public notice are mala fide.

44.title: Which states have declared the movie 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free?
44.article_body: At least eight states have declared the movie 'The Kashmir Files', which stars Anupam Kher, Mithun Chakraborty among others, as tax-free. The film, based on the 1990 exodus of Hindus from Kashmir Valley, will be tax-free in UP, Goa, Tripura, MP, Karnataka, Haryana, Gujarat and Uttarakhand. Karnataka government also said it'll screen the film in state Assembly on Tuesday.

45.title: Babar smashes Test hundred after 2 years, pulls off Suryakumar Yadav-like celebration
45.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam smashed his first Test hundred after over two years by reaching the three-figure mark in the second innings of the Karachi Test against Australia off 180 deliveries. Babar celebrated his hundred first with a roar and then pulled off a Suryakumar Yadav-like 'Keep calm, I am here' celebration while pointing towards his teammates.

46.title: Lewis Hamilton to change name to include his mother Carmen's surname
46.article_body: Seven-time Formula 1 world champion Lewis Hamilton has revealed that he will change his name to incorporate his mother Carmen's original surname, Larbalestier. "I don't really fully understand the whole idea that when people get married the woman loses her name and I really want my mum's name to continue on with the Hamilton name," he added.

47.title: Pakistan Cricket Board planning to introduce women's PSL early next year
47.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja said the board is planning to introduce a Pakistan Super League (PSL) for women in January next year with foreign players. "We've to take steps to have a proper domestic calendar for women with three-day matches," he added. Meanwhile, Pakistan have lost all its opening four matches in 2022 Women's World Cup.

48.title: 3 arrested for ₹6 cr heist at Belagavi cooperative bank in K'taka
48.article_body: Belagavi Police has arrested three people, including a bank clerk, for robbing the Belagavi District Credit Cooperative Bank of cash and ornaments worth nearly ₹6 crore. Cash worth ₹4.2 crore and three kilograms of gold and silver ornaments worth ₹1,63,72,220 have been recovered. The accused have been identified as Basavraj Hunshikatti, Santosh Kalappa Kambar and Yamanappa Laxman Belwal.

49.title: Ukraine crisis shows need for reform in UNSC: Japan Foreign Minister
49.article_body: Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi said on Tuesday that Russia-Ukraine crisis has highlighted need for reforming United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Hayashi's comment comes weeks after Russia, which is a permanent member of UNSC, vetoed a draft resolution that demanded Moscow to withdraw its troops from Ukraine. US, UK, France and China are the four other permanent members of UNSC.

50.title: 15-month-old girl run over by truck outside shanty in Gr Noida
50.article_body: A 15-month-old girl child was killed on Tuesday morning after a truck ran over her outside her shanty in Greater Noida's Surajpur area. "As soon as we received the information about the incident, the police staff was rushed to the spot," an official said. A truck bearing Haryana's registration number ran the girl over, the official added.

51.title: Over 4,800 flats in Pune on list of lapsed projects in Maharashtra
51.article_body: The 407 projects that lapsed in Maharashtra in 2021 include 4,852 flats in 92 Pune housing projects of which 51% flats are sold, property consultants ANAROCK said after analysing MahaRERA data. A project is considered lapsed if developer fails to complete it on time, making it difficult for owners to mortgage or sell properties as banks won't finance the project.

52.title: B'luru records 61 new COVID cases, 0 deaths on Monday; 229 recover
52.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 61 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths on Monday. Data released by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) revealed that 229 people were discharged or have recovered from the virus in the city in the last 24 hours. A total of 7,311 coronavirus tests were done in the city on March 14 and 8,140 vaccine doses were administered.

53.title: Ukraine's Prez asks for more weapons from European nations amid war
53.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday urged European nations to send more weapons to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces invading the country. "We all are the targets of Russia and everything will go against Europe if Ukraine won't stand," he said. "So I would like to ask you to help yourself by helping us," Zelenskyy added.

54.title: Those cutting, damaging trees to celebrate Holi to be penalised: BMC
54.article_body: BMC on Monday said action will be taken against Mumbai residents cutting or damaging trees for Holi celebrations. "If anybody is caught, that person can be imprisoned for seven days or one year and may also have to pay a penalty between ₹1,000 and ₹5,000," an official said. Civic officials will keep an eye with help of surveillance teams.

55.title: Gurugram hotel manager buys ₹2 lakh gold with guest's debit cards
55.article_body: A hotel manager in Gurugram was arrested for allegedly stealing debit cards of a guest and making transactions worth ₹3.1 lakh, police said. The manager had accompanied the 60-year-old guest to an ATM to withdraw money for paying his hotel bill. Since the elderly man was allegedly drunk, the accused withdrew ₹1 lakh cash and bought gold worth ₹2.1 lakh.

56.title: Israeli forces kill 2 Palestinians in West Bank: Palestine ministry
56.article_body: Palestine Health Ministry on Tuesday said Israeli forces killed two Palestinians and injured several others in two separate raids in occupied West Bank. As per Israeli border police, one of the Palestinians was neutralised after he opened fire at the police during an operation at Balata refugee camp. Police added another Palestinian died during a raid at Qalandia refugee camp.

57.title: Freedom of religion not absolute in India like in US: HC in hijab verdict
57.article_body: In its verdict on the hijab controversy, the Karnataka High Court said that freedom of religion is subject to restrictions in India and it's not like in US or Australia, where it is defined in absolute terms. "Whichever be the religion, whatever is stated in the scriptures, does not become per se mandatory in a wholesale way," the court said.

58.title: I lead 3 lives, for people, camera & close ones: Siddhant Chaturvedi
58.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said that he leads three lives, the first being for the people, the second for the camera, and the third for his friends and family. "Apart from the poems I write, I don't think a lot of people have access to the third part of my life," he added. Siddhant stated that he likes it that way.

59.title: 3 EU leaders to visit Kyiv amid war to show support for Ukraine
59.article_body: Prime Ministers of European Union members Slovenia, Poland and the Czech Republic are on their way to Kyiv on Tuesday amid attacks by Russian forces on the Ukrainian capital. The aim is "to confirm the unequivocal support of...European Union for the sovereignty...of Ukraine", Czech PM Petr Fiala said. Major road and train routes from Kyiv are still open.

60.title: Albie Morkel joins Bangladesh as power-hitting coach for ODI series vs SA
60.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Albie Morkel has been appointed as power-hitting coach of Bangladesh ahead of their upcoming ODI series against South Africa, confirmed Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) Cricket Operations Chairman Jalal Yunus. Notably, this is the first time that Bangladesh has appointed a power-hitting coach. The 40-year-old has represented South Africa in one Test, 58 ODIs and 50 T20Is.

61.title: B'luru man sues restaurant for charging 40 paise extra, fined ₹4,000
61.article_body: A Bengaluru man who sued a restaurant for overcharging him 40 paise has been fined  ₹4,000 by a court. He was ordered to pay the amount as compensation to Hotel Empire on Central Street after claiming that the incident caused him "mental shock and agony". The court imposed the fine for wasting its time for his personal publicity.

62.title: Govt has no plans to introduce cryptocurrency: MoS Finance
62.article_body: The government is not planning to introduce a cryptocurrency that will be regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday. Cryptocurrencies are currently unregulated in India, he added. ''RBI doesn't issue cryptocurrency. Traditional paper currency is a legal tender and is issued by RBI," he clarified.

63.title: US employee moves into office cubicle, says 'job doesn't pay enough'; evicted
63.article_body: An employee in the US moved into a cubicle at his office, claiming that he can't afford to live in an apartment due to his low income. Simon documented his living conditions through TikTok videos, which showed how he stores his food and clothes at the office. He was evicted from the office after his videos and pictures went viral.

64.title: DU to allow students to complete their final exams, obtain degrees
64.article_body: Delhi University will allow students who could not complete their degrees to return and take their final exams as a part of its year-long centenary celebrations starting on May 1. Responding to a question at the Lok Sabha on Monday, Minister of State for Education Dr Subhas Sarkar informed that the university will conduct examinations twice during the centenary year.

65.title: Turkmenistan President's son wins snap presidential election
65.article_body: Turkmenistan's Central Election Commission on Tuesday said Serdar Berdimuhamedov, son of outgoing President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov, won the snap presidential election. Serdar secured nearly 73% votes with his nearest rival in a field of nine candidates mustering just 11%. In power since 2007, the outgoing President called the snap election last month paving way for a generation of new leaders.

66.title: PNB reports fraud of over ₹2,000 crore in NPA account of ITPCL
66.article_body: The Punjab National Bank on Tuesday reported a fraud of ₹2,060 crore in the NPA account of IL&FS Tamil Nadu Power Company Ltd (ITPCL). The bank said it has already made provisions amounting to ₹824.1 crore as per prescribed prudential norms. In February, Punjab & Sind Bank had declared IL&FS Tamil Nadu a fraud account with dues of ₹148 crore.

67.title: Fake railway recruitment drive cheats people of ₹10 crore in Hyd
67.article_body: A fake railway recruitment drive in Hyderabad that cheated people out of over ₹10 crore was busted by the police, following which two people were arrested. Police said a preliminary estimate revealed that the drive defrauded over 100 job aspirants while promising to provide them jobs through backdoor entry processes without examination. Officers recovered ₹9 lakh, two cars and documents.

68.title: Sky turns orange after hot air dumps dust from Sahara desert in Spain, pics surface
68.article_body: The skies in parts of Spain have turned orange after a mass of hot air from the Sahara desert dumped dust after crossing the Mediterranean. Storm Celia brought dust from the desert to southern parts of Spain, with Madrid and Murcia among the places lit up. Spanish officials issued extremely poor air quality ratings.

69.title: Didn't sign H'wood film for heck of it or to tick off box: Alia Bhatt
69.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that she did not sign Hollywood film 'Heart of Stone' for the heck of it or to tick it off the box. "I want to look at opportunities which...have a good part, an interesting dynamic and cast, something that is new and relevant," she said. This will mark Alia's Hollywood debut with actress Gal Gadot.

70.title: Ananya is an important part of Ishaan's life: Neliima Azeem
70.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter's mother Neliima Azeem has called actress Ananya Panday an important part of his life, adding that they are great buddies and good companions. Neliima further said Ananya is a part of their inner circle as well as their family circle. Ishaan and Ananya worked together in 2020 film 'Khaali Peeli' and have sparked dating rumours since then.

71.title: He can replace Chahar in CSK for IPL 2022: Irfan on 19-yr-old Hangargekar
71.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said 19-year-old pacer Rajvardhan Hangargekar, who was part of India's 2022 Under-19 World Cup winning campaign, can replace Deepak Chahar in upcoming IPL. Chahar is currently at National Cricket Academy (NCA) recovering from a hamstring injury sustained during India's third T20I against West Indies. Chahar was bought by CSK for ₹14 crore in recent mega auction.

72.title: Researchers develop algorithm to study Sun's coronal mass ejections
72.article_body: A team of Indian solar physicists has developed an algorithm to study the structure and characteristics of coronal mass ejections (CMEs). Named Simple Radial Gradient Filter (SiRGraF), the algorithm separates the background solar corona to reveal time-scale transient structures of the corona. CMEs are massive clouds of particles that are pushed out into space from the Sun's atmosphere.

73.title: Indian Oil Corporation buys 3 mn barrels of Russian Urals oil amid sanctions: Reports
73.article_body: Amid sanctions against Russia over the Ukraine war, Indian Oil Corporation bought 3 million barrels of Russian Urals oil from Geneva-based trader Vitol for May delivery, said sources. Vitol reportedly sold the cargoes at a discount of $20-$25/barrel to dated Brent. IOC didn't see any issue with the purchase as it wasn't dealing with a sanctioned entity, added sources.

74.title: Germany's greenhouse gas emissions rose by nearly 5% in 2021: Govt
74.article_body: German Environment Agency (UBA) said the country's greenhouse gas emissions rose by just under 5% in 2021 as compared to the year before that. The federal agency added emissions were 39% lower than the 1990s. However, the report revealed that the country emitted 762 million tonnes of carbon-dioxide last year which is 33 million tonnes more than in 2020.

75.title: 2 women Naxals killed in encounter with security forces in Dantewada
75.article_body: Two women Naxals were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Dantewada district of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday, Inspector General of Police (Bastar range) Sundarraj Pattilingam said. He added that two 12-bore rifles and a country-made weapon were recovered from the spot. No security personnel was injured in the operation, the officer added.

76.title: Hijab ban challenged in Supreme Court after Karnataka High Court upholds it
76.article_body: A plea was on Tuesday moved in the Supreme Court challenging the Karnataka High Court order that upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions. The High Court on Tuesday ruled that wearing of hijab by Muslim women doesn't constitute an essential practice in Islam and dismissed the petition to strike down the ban imposed by Karnataka government.

77.title: 509 incidents of Naxal violence reported in 2021: Govt to Lok Sabha
77.article_body: A total of 509 incidents of Naxal or Left Wing Extremism (LWE) were reported in the country in 2021, Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai informed the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. He said that such incidents killed 147 civilians and security personnel last year. The incidents were reported in 46 districts of the country, he added.

78.title: We shot with 2,000 people for Ram's introduction in 'RRR': Rajamouli
78.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli revealed they shot with 2,000 people for actor Ram Charan's introduction sequence in the film. "One person fighting against 2,000 people is absolutely crazy," he added. Rajamouli praised stunt choreographer Solomon Raju for the sequence and said there wasn't a single scratch on anyone. "We shot it for 25 days. It was mad fun," Rajamouli said.

79.title: I'm going to say next year: MI's ₹8 crore buy Archer on playing in IPL
79.article_body: Talking about his availability for MI in IPL 2022, pacer Jofra Archer clarified that he'd only be able to join the franchise next year as he continues to recover from his elbow injury. Archer underwent a second operation on his injured right elbow in December 2021. He was bought by MI for ₹8 crore in IPL mega auction last month.

80.title: There was never infidelity: Will Smith on Rebel Wilson's BAFTA comment
80.article_body: Actor Will Smith reacted to Rebel Wilson's comments about his wife Jada Smith's boyfriends saying, "There's never been infidelity in our marriage". Rebel had said at the BAFTA Awards 2022, "His best performance over the past year was being okay with all his wife's boyfriends." Will further said that he and Jada have never surprised one another with anything ever.

81.title: South Korea to provide Ukraine with non-lethal military supplies
81.article_body: South Korea will provide Ukraine with military supplies except for weapon systems amid Russia's invasion, South Korean Defence Ministry spokesman Boo Seung-chan said on Tuesday. The items will include bulletproof helmets, ready-to-eat meals, blankets and other medical supplies, local media has reported. South Korea had earlier approved sending humanitarian aid of $10 million to Ukraine.

82.title: T'gana govt to fund education of 700 students back from Ukraine: CM
82.article_body: CM KCR on Tuesday said in the state Assembly that the Telangana government will bear the cost of education of 740 students, who were studying medicine in Ukraine and returned after Russia invaded its neighbour. "We'll write on this to the Indian Government immediately," he said. KCR added that students went to Ukraine because they couldn't afford education here.

83.title: Script of 'Spencer' was so precise but never particular: Kristen
83.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart, speaking about the script of her film 'Spencer', said, "I was...impressed with how boldly committed the perspective of the script was because it's such a rich...fascinating world." She added, "The script was so precise but never particular...it never tried to answer...questions." Kristen played Princess Diana in the film and earned her first Oscar nomination for her role.

84.title: Russia will be forced to end war in 10 days due to lack of ammo: Ex-US commander
84.article_body: A former commanding general of the US ground forces in Europe said that Russia will be forced to stop its attack on Ukraine in 10 days, due to a lack of ammunition and manpower. "It's kind of a race actually...until Russia culminates (runs out of resources) and, in my assessment...that's in about 10 days," said Lieutenant General Ben Hodges.

85.title: 147 foreigners brought to India during evacuation from Ukraine: Govt
85.article_body: As many as 147 foreign nationals of 18 countries were rescued and brought to India during the evacuation process of Indians from Ukraine, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said. Many Ukrainian nationals that are family members of Indians were also evacuated. Jaishankar said evacuation from Sumy was extremely complex as Indian students faced prospect of being caught in a crossfire.

86.title: Woman who held 'No war' poster on Russian TV news goes missing: Reports
86.article_body: The woman who interrupted a live news bulletin on Russian state TV channel holding a 'No war' poster has reportedly gone missing. Marina Ovsyannikova, whose lawyers are unable to locate her, is an employee at Channel One and was detained by the police after she held a poster that read "Stop the war, don't believe propaganda, they're lying to you."

87.title: Kawasaki unveils rideable robotic goat; video surfaces
87.article_body: Kawasaki debuted a four-legged electric rideable robotic goat at the 2022 International Robot Exhibition (iREX) in Tokyo last week. The four-legged walking robot 'Bex', which can move on smooth as well as rough terrain, can carry up to 100 kilograms of cargo. The company envisions it can be used for transporting construction materials and carrying out remote industrial site inspections.

88.title: Indian startup ORAI Robotics gifts NFTs to all its employees
88.article_body: Bengaluru-headquartered conversational AI platform ORAI Robotics has gifted Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) as rewards to its entire workforce consisting of over 50 employees. Employees can either store, auction or sell the NFTs back to the employer. Founded by Swapnil Jain and Sujit Das Biswas, the platform facilitates conversations with customers over text, voice and messenger apps.

89.title: Concerned for education, law and order: Shivakumar on Hijab issue
89.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has said, "My greatest concern in this hijab controversy is education and law and order." After the Karnataka High Court gave its verdict to upheld the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions, Shivakumar tweeted, "HC has given a judgement but responsibility for education law and order and communal harmony lies with the state government."

90.title: UP man arrested for posting morphed image of Adityanath & Mayawati
90.article_body: A 24-year-old resident of Jewar, identified as Amir Khan, was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly posting a morphed picture of UP CM Yogi Adityanath and former CM Mayawati on social media. The complaint was filed by a police officer, who took note after the issue was highlighted on Twitter. Khan didn't tell why he uploaded the picture, said police.

91.title: Journalists barred from entering Ukraine's Irpin after US journalist shot dead
91.article_body: The mayor of Ukraine's Irpin, Oleksandr Markushyn, barred journalists from entering the city citing security concerns. "I very much ask all media representatives as well as Ukrainians [that] do not post photos of our servicemen, their equipment or anything that would indicate their location," said Markushyn. This comes after a US journalist was killed in the town.

92.title: 6,000 Aapda Mitras under training to help during disasters: Govt
92.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said that 6,000 community volunteers are being trained under the 'Aapda Mitra' scheme to provide immediate help during natural disasters. The training is being conducted in 30 districts in 25 states and Union Territories in the country, he added. The National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) is implementing the scheme.

93.title: Heat wave warning issued for several states over 4 days, list released
93.article_body: IMD has issued heat wave warning for parts of west Rajasthan from March 15 to 18, over Konkan and Saurashtra-Kutch on March 15 and 16 and over isolated pockets over Gujarat and West Madhya Pradesh from March 15 to 17. It issued similar warning for east Rajasthan for March 16 and 17 and over Odisha from March 16 to 18.

94.title: Messi is an alien without emotions, Ronaldo a human with a soul: Di Canio
94.article_body: Former West Ham player Paolo Di Canio said Lionel Messi is an "alien without emotions" adding that he prefers Cristiano Ronaldo who is a "human with a soul", in comparison to Messi. Messi and Neymar were booed by their own fans throughout PSG's Ligue 1 game against Bordeaux. "Messi's behaviour was not the right one," added Di Canio.

95.title: Ratan Tata-backed BlueStone raises $30 mn, valuation hits $410 mn
95.article_body: Ratan Tata-backed jewellery retailer BlueStone said it has raised over $30 million in funding at a valuation of $410 million. The funding round was led by Sunil Kant Munjal, Chairman, Hero Enterprise. BlueStone Founder Gaurav Singh Kushwaha has confirmed the startup's plans for an initial public offering (IPO), with an aim to raise ₹1,500 crore.

96.title: Women constitute 10.3% of police force in India: Govt in Lok Sabha
96.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday informed the Lok Sabha that women police personnel constitute about 10.3% of the police force in the country. The minister informed that as per data from Bureau of Police Research and Development, Bihar has the highest number of female police personnel (25.30%), followed by Himachal Pradesh (19.15%) and Chandigarh (18.78%).

97.title: Will make calibrated interventions to keep fuel prices under control: Govt
97.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Tuesday said the government will make "calibrated interventions" to keep domestic fuel prices under control and "safeguard the interests of the common man". He added that retail prices of diesel and petrol have not been revised since November 2021. Fuel VAT has been reduced by many state governments too.

98.title: Eiffel Tower grows 6 metres taller after installation of new digital radio antenna
98.article_body: Paris' Eiffel Tower grew taller by six metres after a new digital radio antenna was attached to its top. Built in the late 19th century by Gustave Eiffel, the tower now measures 330 metres. Apart from being a popular tourist spot, it has been used to broadcast transmissions for more than 100 years.

99.title: We are exploring multiple avenues for 'Baahubali 3': Rajamouli
99.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli in an interview has stated that the makers of 'Baahubali' are exploring different avenues for a sequel. "There are multiple things happening around 'Baahubali'...It will take some time but a few exciting updates...will be out in the due course," the filmmaker added. The two-part film series starred Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty and Tamannaah.

100.title: Aamir's daughter shares pic of actor's b'day cake featuring posters of his films
100.article_body: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira took to her Instagram Stories on Monday to share a picture of his birthday cake. It featured the posters of Aamir's films like 'PK', 'Lagaan', 'Dil Chahta Hai' and others. The cake was also decorated with a clapboard which had names of his parents, Zeenat and Tahir, written on it. Aamir turned 57 on Monday.

101.title: Rohit Sharma can become a better Test captain than Virat Kohli: Jaffer
101.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma's captaincy, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said the Team India captain can become a better captain in Test cricket than former captain Virat Kohli. "We are seeing the results of how [Team India] have whitewashed each series," added Jaffer. Kohli holds the record for leading Team India to most Test wins as captain.

102.title: Air pollution linked to depressive symptoms in adolescents: Study
102.article_body: A study that examined 213 adolescent participants (aged 9-13 years) has found that exposure to ozone gas, an air pollutant, released by motor vehicles, power plants etc. causes depressive symptoms in adolescents. The study has found that adolescents who lived in areas with more ozone gas levels showed symptoms like persistent feelings of sadness, sleep disturbances and suicidal thoughts.

103.title: Mobile veterinary units to be launched in Madhya Pradesh
103.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday said mobile veterinary units will be formed in the state in order to provide medical assistance to animals. "These units will function on the lines of 108 services," state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. According to the minister, a veterinarian, an assistant and a driver will be deployed in these vans.

104.title: Russia threatened to arrest McDonald's, IBM execs who criticised govt: WSJ
104.article_body: Russian prosecutors issued warnings to McDonald's, IBM and Yum! Brands threatening to arrest corporate leaders for criticising the government, the Wall Street Journal reported. The companies that are withdrawing from Russia amid Ukraine's invasion were also warned that their assets could be seized. Yum! Brands, which operates KFC and Pizza Hut, and McDonald's have suspended operations in Russia.

105.title: Siraj is unlucky to be in an era where India have huge depth: RCB's Hesson
105.article_body: Former New Zealand coach and RCB's Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said, "Mohammed Siraj is really unlucky in terms of [being] in an era where India have a huge amount of depth in the seam-bowling." "Siraj is a great team man and for me that's hugely valuable," added Hesson. Faf du Plessis will lead RCB in IPL 2022.

106.title: Lee Jung Jae wins Best Actor in Drama Series at Critics Choice Awards
106.article_body: 'Squid Game' actor Lee Jung Jae has won the Best Actor award in a Drama Series at Critics Choice Awards held in the US. "I'm grateful to everyone who loves and supports 'Squid Game'," Lee said while accepting the award. Lee became the first Asian actor to be nominated and win the Best Actor at Critics Choice Awards.

107.title: A dream come true: Shabana on working in American series 'Halo'
107.article_body: Shabana Azmi, who'll be seen in the American series 'Halo', said, "Working on this project has been a dream come true." "The show deals in Artificial Intelligence, which is a completely new genre for me, hence it gave me the opportunity to learn," she added. Shabana further said she "thoroughly enjoyed working with Natascha McElhone, Pablo Schreiber and Jen Taylor".

108.title: China shouldn't support Russia's invasion of Ukraine: UK minister
108.article_body: China shouldn't support Russia in its invasion of Ukraine, UK Minister James Cleverly said on Tuesday. "We want to build as broad a coalition of opposition to Russia as possible, so of course, we will have those conversations with the Chinese," Cleverly added. His remarks came amid US officials' claims of Russia requesting military equipment from China.

109.title: Tennis players need to be prepared to deal with hecklers: Nadal
109.article_body: Rafael Nadal said that he feels that players "need to be prepared" to deal with the hecklers. Nadal referred to the incident where female tennis player Naomi Osaka was heckled by a spectator in the middle of her Indian Wells match. "In the real world, that happens...I feel very sorry for what happened to Osaka," Nadal added.

110.title: India need to play Test cricket on better wickets: Parthiv Patel
110.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said India need to play Test cricket on better wickets, following their 2-0 series whitewash in the two-match Test series against Sri Lanka. Patel added that Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne's 107 in the second innings of the Bengaluru Test will send a message to other batters. "If you...apply yourself...you can score runs," stated Patel.

111.title: Invasive insects will kill 1.4 million US street trees by 2050: Study
111.article_body: A recent study has found that invasive insects will kill 1.4 million street trees in the US in next 30 years costing over $900 million to replace. The study predicted that 90% of these tree deaths would be due to emerald ash borer. As per the study, New York, Chicago and Milwaukee would be the hotspots of these tree deaths.

112.title: Prabhas' 24-yr-old fan dies by suicide after 'Radhe Shyam' gets negative reviews: Report
112.article_body: A 24-year-old fan of actor Prabhas died by suicide at his home in Andhra Pradesh, as per a report by ETimes. He reportedly took the step after Prabhas' latest release 'Radhe Shyam' received negative reviews, the report further said. The police reportedly rushed to the spot and an investigation followed.

113.title: RR launch their new jersey, share video featuring stuntman Robbie Maddison
113.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) have launched their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. The jersey features horizontal stripes in multiple shades of pink. Further, the collars and sleeves of the jersey are dark blue in colour. RR shared a video on social media featuring Australian stuntman Robbie Maddison 'delivering' the jersey to Sanju Samson, Riyan Parag and Yuzvendra Chahal.

114.title: Mukesh Ambani's grandson Prithvi seen for first 1st time in public, pics surface
114.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani’s grandson, Prithvi Akash Ambani, was on Tuesday spotted for the first time in public with his mother Shloka Ambani at his nursery school in Mumbai. Earlier, while mentioning that they wanted Prithvi to lead a simple life, Ambanis said he will be attending the same nursery school where both his parents went for their schooling.

115.title: Australia, Netherlands start legal action against Russia over 2014 flight crash
115.article_body: Australia and the Netherlands have begun joint legal action against Russia at the UN aviation agency over its alleged role in the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 in 2014. The flight had crashed in eastern Ukraine's Donetsk after being hit by a Russian missile during Crimea's annexation by Russian forces. All 298 passengers and crew on board were killed.

116.title: Tom Cruise's 'Top Gun: Maverick' to screen at Cannes Film Festival
116.article_body: Tom Cruise-starrer 'Top Gun: Maverick' will be screened at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, according to The Hollywood Reporter. However, the official world premiere of the action film will happen in San Diego a few days before the Cannes screening. The Joseph Kosinski directorial, a follow-up to the 1986 'Top Gun', will have its North American premiere on May 27.

117.title: Proud of the person you're: Shaheen pens note on Alia's 29th b'day
117.article_body: Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish the actress on her 29th birthday. Shaheen posted a picture with Alia and wrote, "I'm so proud of you. Of the person you're evolving into...of the person you work so hard to be." She added, "We call you sunshine because you are dazzling, life-affirming and unfiltered."

118.title: Curfew announced in Ukraine's Kyiv amid Russian shelling
118.article_body: The mayor of Kyiv announced a 35-hour curfew in the city starting at 8 pm local time on Tuesday as the Ukrainian capital was hit by shelling from Russian forces. The authorities said that at least two people were killed in the shelling. Two major blasts were reportedly heard in the city just before dawn.

119.title: Mandhana, Kaur two most dangerous batters: Ellyse Perry on India-Aus match
119.article_body: With Australia set to face India in their next match in the Women's ODI World Cup, Australia's Ellyse Perry has termed Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur as the two most dangerous batters in the tournament. "We are constantly aware of the power in the Indian batting line-up," she added. Currently, Australia are unbeaten in the tournament with four straight wins.

120.title: Jack Ma's Ant sells shares in China tech outlet 36Kr Holdings
120.article_body: Billionaire Jack Ma's Ant has sold its entire stake in China-based tech outlet 36Kr Holdings, a regulatory filing showed. Ant held about 18% of 36Kr Holdings as of early 2021, Bloomberg data revealed. The shares of Alibaba, which owns a third of Ant, fell 10% in New York on Monday, while 36Kr Holdings tumbled 12%.

121.title: 3 inmates including 2 Bangladeshi women escape from Vadodara's reform home
121.article_body: Three women who were sent to Nari Sanrakshan Gruh in Vadodara after being detained by Ahmedabad Police escaped from the reform home in the early hours of Tuesday. Two of these women are Bangladeshi who were caught with fake Aadhaar cards on train at Vadodara railway station. Police had seized fake SIM cards, mobile phones, cash, ATM cards from them.

122.title: 6 held for cheating 200 people in insurance policy scam in Faridabad
122.article_body: Haryana's Faridabad Police arrested six people for allegedly cheating more than 200 people across several states in an insurance policy scam. The accused had been operating from a call centre in Delhi's Janak Puri, police said. "The accused posed as LIC agents and contacted policyholders...made false promises of better returns...extracted money on the pretext of insurance policies," police added.

123.title: NIA files chargesheet against 16 in ₹20,000-crore Mundra Port drug seizure case
123.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has filed its first chargesheet against 16 alleged narcotics traffickers, including Afghan and Iranian nationals, in connection with the seizure of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port. Nearly 3,000 kg heroin worth around ₹20,000 crore from Afghanistan was seized by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) on September 13.

124.title: Is there anything you can't do: Samantha to Alia on her 29th b'day
124.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actress Samantha Prabhu wished actress Alia Bhatt on her 29th birthday. Sharing a picture featuring Alia, Samantha wrote, "Happy birthday @aliaabhat...Is there anything you cannot do? Can't wait to celebrate all your achievements....we all know you're just getting started." Earlier also, Samantha lauded Alia's performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and called it a "masterpiece".

125.title: I proudly call you my very own Brahmāstra: Karan on Alia's b'day
125.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar on Tuesday took to Twitter to wish actress Alia Bhatt on her 29th birthday, writing, "10 years ago I didn’t know that one day I could proudly call you my very own Brahmāstra." Karan also shared a poster of Alia from upcoming film 'Brahmāstra' and called her the "wind beneath the wings of this labour of love".

126.title: We never knew what it was like to play with the pink ball in India: Rohit
126.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma admitted that pink-ball Tests are challenging, adding that the team is learning to make adjustments having earlier never known what it was like to play with the pink-ball in India. "We have seen Ravindra Jadeja grow as a batter and he seems to get better and better," stated Rohit.

127.title: Zomato, Blinkit sign term-sheet for merger: Reports
127.article_body: Online food delivery firm Zomato and online grocer Blinkit, formerly known as Grofers, have reportedly signed a term-sheet for a merger, reports said. The two companies are likely to approach the Competition Commission of India for an approval soon. Zomato currently owns about 10% stake in Blinkit and may reportedly invest more into the cash-strapped startup until the merger closes.

128.title: Pune Metro sees footfall of over 2.5 lakh commuters since launch
128.article_body: Pune Metro Rail has recorded a footfall of over 2.5 lakh commuters and earned ₹35 lakh in fare revenue since it began services nine days back, officials said on Tuesday. Pune Metro Rail Project was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on March 6 and presently runs on two stretches. The minimum fare has been fixed at ₹10 for both corridors.

129.title: KTR to inaugurate LB Nagar underpass, Bairamalguda flyover in Hyd tomorrow
129.article_body: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao will inaugurate the Bairamalguda flyover and LB Nagar underpass in Hyderabad on Wednesday. The projects are part of the Strategic Road Development Program (SRDP). The 780-metre flyover will ease traffic coming from Owaisi Hospital junction and moving towards Uppal Junction, while the underpass will ease traffic coming from Uppal.

130.title: SC stays Centre's decision to ban telecast of news channel MediaOne
130.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday stayed the Centre's decision banning the telecast of Malayalam news channel MediaOne on security grounds. The channel had challenged Kerala High Court's order upholding the Centre's January 31 directive. "For six weeks, we've been shut down only because it is run by people belonging to a minority community," the channel's lawyer told SC.

131.title: 700 investors face I-T dept's scrutiny for unaccounted crypto transactions: Report
131.article_body: India's I-T department is reportedly planning to issue notices to 700 investors over high-value crypto transactions. "We've a long list of people who were transacting in crypto assets but weren't paying tax...[We've] shortlisted about 700 transactions, where tax liability is very high," an official told The Economic Times. They're likely to face 30% tax, penalty and interest, the report said.

132.title: PM asks BJP leaders to garland Nadda 1st at meeting, video surfaces
132.article_body: PM Narendra Modi at a BJP parliamentary party meeting on Tuesday asked BJP leaders to garland party chief JP Nadda before him. A video shows that BJP leaders got a huge garland for PM Modi after the party's win in recent state elections, but he asked Nadda to come in front. Party leaders also chanted slogans of 'Modi zindabad'.

133.title: Ram Charan was surprised by my acting skills during RRR shoot: Jr NTR
133.article_body: Speaking about working with Ram Charan in 'RRR', Jr NTR said that the former was surprised by his acting skills during the shoot of the film. He added that Charan is a great human being and he feels very lucky to have him as a friend. Jr NTR further said that he's excited for audiences to watch their film 'RRR'.

134.title: Govt staff should not use mobiles for personal use during office hours: Madras HC
134.article_body: Madras High Court on Tuesday said that government servants should not be allowed to use mobile phones for personal use during their office hours. This comes after a health department official filed a petition against a suspension order issued against her for using mobile phone at workplace. The court further directed the state government to frame regulations in this regard.

135.title: 12 inspectors among 14 police personnel transferred in Gurugram
135.article_body: A total of 14 Gurugram police personnel, including 12 inspectors and two sub-inspectors, have been transferred within the district, officials said. "All the transfers were...based on the tenure of posting of an officer, and other administrative factors," a police official said. Notably, this is the first reshuffle after Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran took over the post in February.

136.title: Kim is not a bad person, kids want us to stay together: Kanye West
136.article_body: Rapper Kanye West made a series of posts on Instagram writing that he is not a bad person and neither is his ex-wife Kim Kardashian. He further wrote Kim's reality show 'The Kardashians' needs a new narrative, adding their four children want them to stay together. "I have no celebrity 'friends' that will speak up on my behalf," he added.

137.title: Ali cheated on me; kept calling me even after he got married: Sara
137.article_body: After ex-husband, Ali Merchant's entry in 'Lock Upp', contestant Sara Khan spoke about why they separated months after their wedding on 'Bigg Boss 4'. She said, "I was cheated on a lot of times. I'd forgive...and get back. Then...I...decided to move ahead and get out of it." Sara added that even after getting married again, Ali didn't stop calling her.

138.title: Down in my worst debt, anyone in my place would die by suicide: Kaaranvir
138.article_body: Actor and 'Lock Upp' contestant Kaaranvir Bohra said he is "down in the worst debt" of his life. "Since 2015, whatever work I accept it's to pay off debt...I feel so sorry for myself and for my family, what am I giving them...If someone else was in my position...he would have died by suicide...I'm deep in debt," he added.

139.title: Rajasthan has inked deals worth over ₹10 lakh crore: Industry Min
139.article_body: State Industry Minister Shakuntala Rawat said that the Rajasthan Government has signed over 4,000 MoUs and letters of interest which amounts to ₹10.41 lakh crore of investment in the state. She claimed that this "will generate employment opportunities for 9.40 lakh residents". Rawat added, "For the first time, roadshows were organised in each district to invite investments in the state."

140.title: Everybody has to look alike in schools: Subramanian Swamy on hijab verdict
140.article_body: Senior BJP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy hailed the Karnataka High Court's decision on the hijab controversy. "All that is being asked for is that when you go to school...you have to look like everybody else," Swamy said. "They can't prove if their fundamental rights were breached unreasonably," Swamy added.

141.title: Bentley to roll out one electric car annually for 5 years from 2025
141.article_body: Luxury carmaker Bentley plans to build a new electric car annually for five years from 2025. Bentley, which is targeting to be end-to-end carbon-neutral by 2030, recorded an operating profit of $427 million for 2021, which was $405 million more than in 2020. Bentley's deliveries jumped 31% to 14,659 cars on demand for new hybrid models.

142.title: Govt releases guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination of 12-14 age group
142.article_body: The Centre released guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination of children in the 12-14 age group, which begins from March 16, stating that only the Corbevax vaccine would be administered to them. Two doses of Corbevax would be administered at an interval of 28 days. Vaccination can be availed through online registration (beginning 9 am on March 16) or through onsite walk-in.

143.title: Our batters need to step up in last innings against Australia: Hasan Ali
143.article_body: Pakistan pacer Hasan Ali has said that their batters will "have to take responsibility in the last innings" in order to make a comeback in the second Test against Australia. Pakistan made 148 runs in their first innings which gave Australia a lead of 408 runs. Ali also added that the Australian pacers bowled "quicker" than Pakistan speedsters.

144.title: 7 Indian players including Vihari, Easwaran to feature in DPL 2022
144.article_body: Seven Indian cricketers including Hanuma Vihari and Abhimanyu Easwaran will be participating in the Dhaka Premier League (DPL). Notably, these seven players went unsold at the IPL mega auction and will now feature in the tournament scheduled to start from Tuesday. All ten clubs participating in the DPL are allowed to field one overseas player.

145.title: Suryakumar likely to miss MI's IPL 2022 opener vs DC: Reports
145.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Suryakumar Yadav will reportedly miss his side's IPL 2022 opener against Delhi Capitals on March 27 at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. The 31-year-old is yet to recover from a hairline fracture on his thumb sustained during T20I series against West Indies last month. He was subsequently ruled out of following T20I series against Sri Lanka.

146.title: Nearly 6,000 MSMEs got shut down during FY21 and FY22: Govt
146.article_body: Minister of State for MSMEs Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma on Monday said 5,907 MSMEs got shut down in FY21 and FY22. In FY21, 330 MSMEs got shut down, which increased nearly 17-fold in FY22 to 5,577 MSMEs. Maharashtra topped the chart with 1,608 MSME shutdowns, followed by 527 in Bihar, 521 in Tamil Nadu and 442 in Uttar Pradesh.

147.title: Central Vista Avenue revamp work may end by May: Centre
147.article_body: Union Minister of State, Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore told Rajya Sabha that the Central Vista Avenue revamp work might end by May 2022. The redevelopment of Central Vista Avenue was initially due to be completed by Republic Day. Central Public Works Department (CPWD) is also repairing damage caused during Republic Day parade preparations, officials said.

148.title: EU leaders to travel to Kyiv in show of support for Ukraine
148.article_body: The leaders of Poland, Czech Republic and Slovenia will travel to Kyiv on Tuesday to show support for Ukraine amid Russia's attack. The aim is to express the European Union's unequivocal support for Ukraine and its freedom and independence, said Czech PM Petr Fiala, who will be accompanied by Slovenia PM Janez Jansa and Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki.

149.title: Ashwin loves challenges, he wants to find answer for everything: Irfan Pathan
149.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised Ravichandran Ashwin, stating that the off-spinner loves challenges and wants to find an answer for everything. Irfan added, "I feel if Ashwin gets an easy thing, he will want to make it more difficult." He further said, "Ashwin got wickets with difficulties [against Sri Lanka] but he would have got satisfaction from that."

150.title: Shane Watson appointed assistant coach of Delhi Capitals
150.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has been named the new assistant coach of Delhi Capitals (DC) for the upcoming season of IPL. Speaking on his appointment, Watson said, "IPL is the best T20 tournament in the world...I have got incredible memories as a player, and now coaching opportunities...I am really excited."

151.title: Elon Musk's Starlink app becomes most-downloaded in Ukraine: Report
151.article_body: Elon Musk-owned Starlink's app was the most-downloaded app in Ukraine on Monday afternoon after reaching the top spot on Sunday, media reports said. Sensor Tower said the app was downloaded 21,000 times globally Sunday across Apple and Google app stores, of which most downloads came from Ukraine. It has been downloaded nearly 1,00,000 times in Ukraine according to Sensor Tower.

152.title: Dress code should be followed in schools: Hema Malini on hijab ban
152.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini on Tuesday reacted to the hijab issue and said dress code should be followed in schools and religion shouldn't be dragged in it. She further said that there is no need to impose a new ban on hijab in other institutions or working places. Karnataka HC upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

153.title: Is there any policy to regulate illegal food joints?: HC to BMC
153.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday asked BMC if there's a policy to regulate eateries and food outlets, which don't have required licenses but operate through food delivery companies. The Indian Hotel & Restaurant Association filed a plea, claiming that apps picked up food from these eateries, operating from home. These eateries violate the Mumbai Municipal Corporation Act, it added.

154.title: Dog seen carrying head of baby in Hyderabad, police look for body
154.article_body: A stray dog was seen carrying the head of a baby on the streets in Hyderabad on Sunday. When the locals chased the dog, it left the head in the bush. Police sent the head for autopsy and are looking for the body of the baby. Police are scanning CCTV footage to find out where the dog got the head.

155.title: Trying to see how to be best mom to you: Anushka shares post for daughter
155.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma on Monday took to Instagram Stories to share a post for her daughter Vamika. The post read, "Dear child, I spend so much time trying to figure out how to be the best mother to you. I know I won't always get it right." Anushka gave birth to her daughter with Virat Kohli in January last year.

156.title: Cong leadership in 'cuckoo land', going downhill since 2014: Sibal
156.article_body: Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Tuesday said that the party's leadership is "living in cuckoo land" and has been "going downhill" since 2014. "We have suffered humiliating defeats from time to time," he said. Sibal further said that Congress could not connect with the electorate and has been unable to lead from the front and reach out to people.

157.title: Tough task to stick to Ambedkar's mission in the 'age of flattery': Mayawati
157.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati said that it is a tough task to stick to the mission of Babasaheb Ambedkar in this "age of flattery" and asserted that her party, through its movement, is taking this mission forward. Speaking on the occasion of the birth anniversary of BSP founder Kanshi Ram, she said, BSP gave a new dimension to the country's politics.

158.title: Cong should expel me: Ex-U'khand CM Rawat on ticket selling allegations
158.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM and Congress leader Harish Rawat on Tuesday said that the party should expel him if the allegations of ticket selling in Assembly polls against him are proven true. "The allegation of selling posts and party tickets is very serious," he added. "'Harish Rawat evil' should also be burnt by Congress in this Holi," Rawat further said.

159.title: Paytm says RBI order on Paytm Payments Bank 'won't impact overall business'
159.article_body: After RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers, its parent company, One 97 Communications, in a stock exchange filing on Tuesday said that the measure "will not materially impact Paytm’s overall business." On Monday, Paytm Payments Bank also dismissed a report that claimed that RBI’s action was taken as the bank was sharing information with China-based entities.

160.title: I declined 'huge' movie offers due to kissing scenes: Amrita Rao
160.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao has revealed that she declined "huge" movie offers only because she wasn't comfortable doing kissing and lovemaking sequences on screen. "I regret not doing some movies but I had no one experienced to advise me back then," added Amrita. "However, by and large, the movies that I chose to do have been successful...and relevant," stated Amrita.

161.title: China to divert flights away from Shanghai amid COVID-19 surge
161.article_body: China has decided to redirect several international flights from Shanghai airport to other cities from March 21 to May 1 in the wake of COVID-19 surge in the city, said the government. Over 100 flights of five Chinese airlines will reportedly be diverted. A partial lockdown has been imposed in Shanghai to check the spread of the virus.

162.title: BJP MPs' kids didn't get tickets in recent state polls because of me: PM Modi
162.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that many BJP MPs and leaders were seeking poll tickets for their children in the recently-concluded Assembly elections but were denied the same. He said that the tickets were denied as granting them would come under "dynastic politics", adding, "They did not get tickets because of me."

163.title: 67-yr-old Asian woman punched 125 times in the head and face, spat at in US
163.article_body: A 67-yr-old Asian woman was punched more than 125 times in the head and face, spat at and called an "Asian b**ch" by a 42-year-old in New York. Police identified the suspect Tammel Esco on Monday and charged him with attempt to murder and assault for the attack that was caught on surveillance video. The woman suffered facial bone fractures.

164.title: I will make India's first NFT crowdfunded film: Vishal Malhotra
164.article_body: Actor Vishal Malhotra has stated that he will turn a filmmaker by making India's first NFT (Non-Fungible Token) crowdfunded film. "I decided that I wanted to merge the two main interests that I have, films and NFTs. I...thought why not create funding by selling the NFTs and from that money we make a film," Vishal added.

165.title: Important to continue playing in WC like we did against WI: Harmanpreet
165.article_body: Ahead of India-England 2022 Women's World Cup match, India vice-captain Harmanpreet Kaur said it's important for her side to repeat their performance in the win against West Indies in the upcoming matches. India had defeated West Indies by 155 runs, with Smriti Mandhana (123) and Harmanpreet (109) being the top-scorers. India will play England on Wednesday.

166.title: Pakistan's Bazaar raises $70 mn in nation's second-biggest funding
166.article_body: Pakistan-based e-commerce startup Bazaar has raised $70 million in funding, making it the nation's second-largest funding round. The round was led by Dragoneer Investment Group and Tiger Global Management. Pakistani startups raised more than $350 million last year, greater than the amount over the previous six years combined. Bazaar operates in 21 cities across Pakistan.

167.title: Pune Metro may increase train frequency on Garware College-Vanaz route
167.article_body: Maha Metro is planning to increase the frequency of trains between Garware College and Vanaz amid growing footfall of passengers. Maha Metro said it'll also reduce the gap between two trains from the present half an hour to 15 minutes. When the metro will reach up to Shivajinagar in June, the wait time will be reduced to five minutes.

168.title: 300% rise in bookings for one-way flights out of Hong Kong amid COVID-19 cases
168.article_body: Demand for flights leaving Hong Kong surged 306% as compared to the same time last year amid talks of mass COVID-19 testing and lockdowns. A "steep rise" in outbound bookings from January 4 to March 7 has been observed. About half of Hong Kong's 7.4 million people have already been infected with COVID-19 following the omicron wave, a study claimed.

169.title: If PSL uses auction model, we will see who goes to play in IPL over PSL: Ramiz Raja
169.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja has said that he wants to switch Pakistan Super League (PSL) to the auction model from the current draft system. "If we take PSL to auction model, increase the purse, then I'll put it in IPL bracket. And then we'll see who goes to play the IPL over the PSL," he added.

170.title: Billionaire's 31-yr-old son killed by boat propeller while trying to save fiancée in US
170.article_body: Juan Carlos Escotet Alviarez, the 31-year-old son of a Venezuelan banking billionaire, died while trying to save his fiancée during a fishing competition in Florida, US over the weekend. Alviarez dived into the water to save his fiancée after she fell off the boat. After entering the water, Alviarez was struck by a boat propeller and died from his injuries.

171.title: Why is Kapil Sibal speaking RSS, BJP's language: Cong MP Manickam
171.article_body: Congress MP Manickam Tagore on Tuesday questioned party leader Kapil Sibal over his remarks against the party leadership, saying, "Why [is Sibal] speaking...language of RSS/BJP?" Sibal in an interview said that the party leadership is "living in cuckoo land". Tagore also claimed that RSS and BJP want "Nehru-Gandhi's" out of Congress leadership as then the party will become "Janata party".

172.title: Radicon Vedantam's Greater Noida office sealed for non-payment to homebuyers
172.article_body: The office of realty firm Radicon Vedantam in Greater Noida's Sector 16C has been sealed for failing to pay ₹4 crore to homebuyers. "We'll seal the offices of other realty firms tomorrow if they don't clear homebuyers' payments,” said VP Mishra, Tehsildar of Dadri. Properties of different developers are likely to be auctioned too for failing to hand over possession.

173.title: Actress Amrita Rao shares pics of secret wedding for 1st time after 8 years
173.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao and RJ Anmol have for the first time shared pictures from their secret wedding, that took place in 2014. "The news of my wedding could have hampered my career prospects which, luckily, Anmol understood," she said while speaking about their secret wedding. "However, getting married at the right time was also important," Amrita added.

174.title: My dream is to make an electric highway from Delhi to Jaipur: Gadkari
174.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said his dream is to make India's first electric highway between Delhi and Jaipur. He said the market is ready to support his ministry's initiative. He added that the government has so far received 47 proposals to set up ropeway cables in Manipur, Sikkim, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh and Kashmir.

175.title: I'll talk to Kohli about coming back to academy: Childhood coach Rajkumar
