347.title: Lift collapses from 40th floor in Mumbai building; 1 dead, 1 injured
347.article_body: A 43-year-old man was killed while a 26-year-old man was injured as lift of building in Mumbai collapsed from 40th floor during repair work. Lift had not been working since two days. Both workers, who were atop lift, were removed after collapse. The injured, who reportedly had severe head injury during the incident, has been admitted to the hospital.

348.title: Fox News journalist injured, hospitalised in war-stricken Ukraine
348.article_body: A Fox News journalist, Benjamin Hall, got injured while working outside of Ukraine's Kyiv and was hospitalised, said the channel. "This is a stark reminder for all journalists who are putting their lives on the line every day to deliver the news from a war zone," added the channel. The US State Department said it was ready to help Hall.

349.title: Captaining India in Tests was a huge thing for me: Rohit Sharma
349.article_body: Rohit Sharma, who was named Team India's new Test captain ahead of the Sri Lanka Tests, has said captaining in red-ball cricket was a huge thing for him. "I've not captained much in red-ball cricket. I have done it in a few games in Ranji Trophy...team supported me a lot [against SL]," he added. India won the two-Test series 2-0.

350.title: Mumbai civic body asks Union Minister to demolish illegal addition to bungalow
350.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), while issuing a fresh notice, has asked Union Minister Narayan Rane to demolish the alleged illegal construction at his eight-storey bungalow in Juhu within 15 days. As per the notice, if the unauthorised addition is not removed within the stipulated time, the civic body will raze it and also recover demolition charges.

351.title: People who wear short, sexy dresses are judged, considered useless: Neena
351.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta took to Instagram to share a video in which she said, "People who wear short, sexy dresses are...judged and considered useless. This is not fair." "I am wearing a short dress and let me tell you...I have done many great things in life," added Neena. "Nobody must have ever scolded trolls with such love," a user commented.

352.title: Pune civic body's 1st medical college to come up under PPP model
352.article_body: The first medical college within Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) limits will come up under public-private partnership (PPP) model, Additional Municipal Commissioner (General) Ravindra Binwade said. "The share of public investment...private involvement will be explored later, given...college fulfils all required permissions," he added. "A total of 13 such colleges can be explored," Binwade stated.

353.title: AAP protests outside BJP headquarters in Delhi over 'delay' in MCD polls
353.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Monday protested outside BJP headquarters in Delhi against the alleged delay in holding Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls. BJP has "coerced" the Election Commission to delay polls for "political gains", AAP alleged. "I challenge BJP to make sure...MCD elections are announced in a week's time if it doesn't fear," AAP's Gopal Rai said.

354.title: Ex-Union Minister Vijay Goel's mobile phone snatched near Delhi's Jama Masjid
354.article_body: Former Union Minister and senior BJP leader Vijay Goel's phone was allegedly snatched near Jama Masjid metro station in Delhi on Monday evening, police said. The incident took place when he was travelling from Daryaganj towards Red Fort in a car and had stopped near the metro station gate. Goel was sitting in the car when his phone was snatched.

355.title: Apple supplier Foxconn in talks to build $9 bn plant in Saudi: WSJ
355.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn and Saudi Arabia are discussing building a $9 billion facility jointly that could make microchips, EV components and other electronics, the Wall Street Journal reported. Saudi Arabia is reviewing Foxconn's offer to build a dual-line semiconductor contract manufacturing facility in Neom. Foxconn is also in talks with the UAE about potentially situating the project there.

356.title: Which records set in the first-ever Test 145 years ago are still unbroken?
356.article_body: Australia's Charles Bannerman's record for the highest percentage of runs by a batter in a completed Test innings set in the first-ever Test that started on March 15, 1877 is still unbroken. Bannerman slammed 165*, constituting 67.34% of Australia's 245. Further, England's James Southerton, who featured in the Test, is still the oldest debutant at 49 years and 119 days.

357.title: Shama Sikander marries American businessman James Milliron in Goa, shares pics
357.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander tied the knot with American businessman James Milliron in Goa on Monday. Sharing pictures from the wedding on Instagram, Shama wrote, "Whole." "Congratulations! Wishing you both a lifetime of happiness," actress Sonnalli Seygall commented on Shama's wedding pictures. Shama and James had got engaged on December 31, 2015 in Dubai.

358.title: Little devil, you're weak: Russian space chief to Musk on combat challenge to Putin
358.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to single combat, Russian space agency Roscosmos' head Dmitry Rogozin replied with a verse by Alexander Pushkin calling Musk a "little devil". Quoting the poet, Rogozin wrote, "You, little devil, are still young. You're weak to compete with me; it'd only be a waste of time. Overtake my brother first."

359.title: China sees 5,280 COVID cases for 1st time in 2 years driven by 'stealth Omicron'
359.article_body: China has reported 5,280 COVID-19 cases for the first time since the early days of the pandemic, driven by 'stealth Omicron' variant, reports said. The 'stealth Omicron' - or the BA.2 sub-variant, is 1.5 times more transmissible than the original Omicron strain, studies suggest. At least 10 cities and counties were locked down including Shenzhen, home to 17 million people.

360.title: Vivek used to hug me, we cried during 'The Kashmir Files': Anupam Kher
360.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher said that he cried a lot during and after the making of 'The Kashmir Files'. "Vivek used to hug me and we cried. It was...one of the most difficult roles to enact," he said, adding, "This was my tribute to my father...When I reached the set on first day...actor took back seat...person had to take front seat."

361.title: Manjrekar's old tweet on Pant's keeping resurfaces after he wins Player of Series award
361.article_body: An old tweet by Sanjay Manjrekar on Rishabh Pant's wicketkeeping has resurfaced after the 24-year-old became the first Indian wicketkeeper-batter to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket. Referring to a missed stumping during India's Test series against England, Manjrekar had tweeted that Pant's mistake "tells me all I need to know about Pant the keeper".

362.title: You can't lie to your children: Sunny on protecting her kids from media reports
362.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said she'd be honest with her children in order to protect them from negative reports about her and her husband Daniel Weber. She added, "I'd be...crazy if I didn't think...it would happen. But I think...communication is going to be the best tool." "You can't lie to your children, they're going to find out the truth," Sunny said.

363.title: Pune housing societies protest over water supply, sewage problems
363.article_body: Anandvan Parisar Residents Forum (APRF), an informal association of 25 housing societies, has staged a protest over issues related to water supply, sewage system and roads in Pune's NIBM area. "All the residents of the area are facing hardship in commuting and the burden of paying for water tankers," an APRF official said. The protest was held on Sunday.

364.title: It was nothing other than an accident: US on Indian missile landing in Pakistan
364.article_body: After India accidentally fired a missile that landed in Pakistan, the US said, "We have no indication as you also heard from our Indian partners that this incident was anything other than an accident." "We refer you of course to the Indian Ministry of Defense for any follow up. We don't have a comment beyond that," the US further said.

365.title: Over 5,800 people booked in 2 months for drinking in public in Delhi
365.article_body: The Delhi Police has booked over 5,800 persons under the Excise Act for allegedly consuming liquor at public places in the city. According to data released by senior police officers, over 2,489 persons were booked under the Delhi Police Act and 1,242 were booked under IPC section 290 (public nuisance). "We call these people 'open drinkers'," said a police official.

366.title: 3 teens drown in MP, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families
366.article_body: Three teens, aged between 15 and 17, drowned while taking a bath near Udaigiri dam in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha on Sunday. The bodies of two youths were retrieved while the search for the third is underway, an official said on Monday. Meanwhile, an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh for the family of each deceased has been announced by the CM.

367.title: TN girl dies by suicide after being told to stand outside class
367.article_body: A Class 9 student died by suicide in Tamil Nadu's Tiruchengode on Saturday, after being made to stand outside for coming late to class. The girl complained of a vomiting sensation after entering the class and went out, an official said. The teacher asked the students to check on her, but the girl had taken the extreme step by then.

368.title: RS gets ultraviolet radiation equipment to contain COVID-19 spread
368.article_body: Ultraviolet C-band radiation equipment has been installed in Rajya Sabha chambers to contain the spread of coronavirus, Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu informed on Monday. Speaking on the first day of the second part of the Budget Session, Naidu added that the recently installed equipment "is very effective in killing the virus." The technology has been developed by CSIR-CSIO.

369.title: Female lawyer attacked with acid in Punjab, escapes unharmed
369.article_body: A female lawyer escaped unharmed after being attacked with acid by two bike-borne men in Punjab's Amritsar. According to reports, the woman was returning home with her brother when the men approached her. One of them sprinkled acid on her but she immediately managed to cover her face with a jacket. Police have registered a case under relevant IPC sections.

370.title: Yellow alert issued for heat wave in Gujarat for next 2 days: IMD
370.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday issued a 'yellow' alert for Gujarat for the next two days as the heatwave intensifies in India. "The temperature might rise around 1-2° C and a severe heatwave is expected in Saurashtra and Gujarat regions. The temperature in Ahmedabad is expected [to be] around 40-41° C," said Manorama Mohanty, Director, Meteorological Centre Ahmedabad.

371.title: Chennai Corporation using drones to spray larvicide in water bodies
371.article_body: The Greater Chennai Corporation has started using drones to spray mosquito larvicide in order to prevent the breeding of mosquitoes in water bodies. Corporation Commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi said two drones are used every day to spray approximately 400 litres of chemicals. He added it was part of the 15 days of anti-larvae chemical spray project started by the corporation.

372.title: Want to take TMC's 'Khela hobe' slogan across India: Shatrughan
372.article_body: Actor and former Union Minister Shatrughan Sinha, who has been announced as TMC's Asansol candidate for Lok Sabha by-election, said on Monday that he wants to take his party's slogan 'Khela hobe' (Game is on) across the country. He further dismissed the Opposition's allegation of him being an "outsider", saying, "I'm no less a Bengali than any other Bengali."

373.title: IMDb changes rating system for 'The Kashmir Files' after 'unusual voting activity'
373.article_body: Film and television review hosting website IMDb has changed its rating system after it "detected unusual voting activity" on 'The Kashmir Files' page. The movie's ratings allegedly dipped after the system change, after which director Vivek Agnihotri said, "This is unusual and unethical." The movie's rating currently stands at 8.3/10, with 2,36,000 votes recorded.

374.title: Face masks of PM in high demand ahead of Holi in UP's Prayagraj
374.article_body: Ahead of Holi, markets in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj are witnessing a high demand for PM Narendra Modi's face masks. According to the shopkeepers, BJP's victory in the Assembly elections has given a boost to the demand for PM Modi's masks. "This year Holi will be celebrated with saffron colour," said a shopkeeper in Prayagraj.

375.title: Man rapes 13-yr-old girl repeatedly on pretext of marriage in Guj
375.article_body: Ahmedabad's Ghatlodia Police on Sunday filed a complaint against a 26-year-old man for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl repeatedly on the pretext of marrying her, reports said. The accused befriended the girl about a year ago and lured her with money and the pretext of marriage, police said. The accused eloped with the girl six months ago, police added.

376.title: Sec 144 in Kalaburagi, Hassan & other K'taka districts ahead of hijab row verdict
376.article_body: Prohibitory orders under CrPC section 144 have been imposed in Karnataka's Bengaluru, Belagavi, Davanagere, Hassan, Kalaburagi and Shivamogga as the High Court will deliver its judgment on hijab ban issue on Tuesday. A ban on gatherings and protests has been imposed in Bengaluru from March 15-March 21. Schools and colleges in Dakshina Kannada and Udupi will remain closed on Tuesday.

377.title: Philippines summons Chinese envoy over navy ship's intrusion
377.article_body: Philippine government summoned Chinese ambassador Huang Xilian on Monday to explain the "illegal intrusion" of a Chinese naval ship into the country's waters. In a statement, Philippine Foreign Ministry said the ship remained in their waters from January 29 to February 1. The government also demanded that Beijing must order its ships to respect Philippine territory and follow international law.

378.title: Channi's greed pulled party down, he's a liability: Cong leader
378.article_body: Following the Congress' defeat in Punjab Assembly elections, former state Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday called Charanjit Singh Channi a "liability" whose "greed pulled the party down". "An asset, are you joking? Thank God he wasn't declared a 'National Treasure' at Congress Working Committee by the 'PBI' lady who proposed him as CM in the first place," he said.

379.title: India's pink, white, red ball form at home in 2022 is outstanding: Sachin
379.article_body: Congratulating India after their pink-ball Test win against Sri Lanka in Bengaluru, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Team India's pink, white...red ball form at home this season has been outstanding." India won red-ball Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali and white-ball (T20I) series against them in Lucknow and Dharamshala. India beat West Indies in white-ball series in Ahmedabad and Kolkata in February.

380.title: Pant becomes first Indian wicketkeeper to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket
380.article_body: Rishabh Pant has become the first Indian wicketkeeper-batter to win Player of the Series award in Test cricket. He was named Player of the Series for scoring 185 runs in the two-match series against Sri Lanka. He had a batting average of 61.66 and strike rate of 120.12 in the series. Pant took five catches and effected three stumpings.

381.title: Farmers to launch protest from March 21 against govt's 'broken promises'
381.article_body: The Samyukt Kisan Morcha on Monday decided to launch a nationwide agitation from March 21 to protest the Centre's 'broken promises' on the issue of forming a panel on MSP. The agitation will be launched in phases and during the second phase from April 11-17, farmers will observe 'MSP guarantee week'. The agitation was earlier suspended on December 9, 2021.

382.title: China's richest billionaires lose over $52 billion in a day as stocks plunge
382.article_body: The combined net worth of China's 78 richest tycoons fell by over $52 billion in a day as Chinese stocks plunged on Monday. Bottled water company Nongfu Spring's Founder and the country's richest person Zhong Shanshan lost the most, with his fortune declining by $5 billion. Tencent's Pony Ma saw his net worth drop by $3.3 billion to $35.2 billion.

383.title: Empire Magazine releases still of Scarlet Witch from Doctor Strange 2
383.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen's new still as Scarlet Witch in the upcoming film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' has been released by the Empire Magazine. The film will also feature Benedict Cumberbatch, who will play Doctor Strange in the film. 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', directed by Sam Raimi, is expected to have cameos by MCU characters.

384.title: I rejoined politics because of Mamata Banerjee: TMC's Babul Supriyo
384.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that he rejoined politics because party supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee asked him to work for the state. Supriyo's remark came after the TMC declared him as its candidate in the Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat. Supriyo had resigned as Union Minister and BJP's MP from Asansol in 2021.

385.title: Kyiv Mayor in selfie video shows damage caused by Russian forces in Ukraine
385.article_body: In a selfie video, Kyiv’s Mayor Vitali Klitschko showed the damage caused in Ukraine amid the ongoing war with Russia. In the clip, Klitschko said, “That's what Russians' war against civilians looks like. Destroyed buildings, destroyed infrastructure...Lives are getting lost." Sharing the video, he also wrote, "Putin's dream of creating a Greater Russia is my country's nightmare."

386.title: I knew only two words in English when I first arrived in Bombay: Anil Agarwal
386.article_body: Anil Agarwal, the 68-year-old billionaire Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources, tweeted, "When I first arrived in Bombay, I knew only two words in English, 'yes' and 'no'." He said, "I held on to my dreams of making it big." He added, "I came to know a cable company was on the brink of bankruptcy...I started dreaming about acquiring that company."

387.title: 700 primary schools in Gujarat managed by 1 teacher each, says govt
387.article_body: As many as 700 government primary schools in Gujarat are run by a single teacher each, who teaches from classes 1 to 8, said the state government's data tabled in the Gujarat Legislature on Monday. Kutch has 100 such schools with one teacher each. Mahisagar has 74 such schools and Tapi has 59 schools, as per the data.

388.title: 'No Time To Die' film editors criticise Oscars for broadcast cuts
388.article_body: 'No Time To Die' editors Tom Cross and Elliot Graham, who won Best Editing at BAFTA Awards 2022, have criticised the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences for cutting eight categories, including Best Film Editing, from the live telecast plans. "All of those nominees...deserve to stand up...same way everyone else does," Cross stated. Graham added, "It's f****d up."

389.title: ED attached wrong properties of ex-Amrapali Director: Auditor to SC
389.article_body: Forensic auditor Pawan Agarwala told the Supreme Court that the Enforcement Directorate has attached wrong properties of Amrapali Group's ex-Director Prem Mishra. These properties need to be detached and auctioned off to generate funds for stalled projects' construction, Agarwala said. SC had directed ED to investigate alleged money laundering by realtors, including Amrapali Group.

390.title: HC to deliver judgment on hijab ban tomorrow, section 144 imposed in B'luru
390.article_body: The Karnataka HC will deliver its judgment on the hijab ban issue on Tuesday and section 144 was imposed in Bengaluru from March 15-March 21, banning all types of gatherings and protests. The protests in the state began in January after some Muslim girl students in the Udupi district alleged that they were banned from attending classes while wearing hijab.

391.title: Himanshu continues shooting for 'Aggar Tum Na Hote' despite injury
391.article_body: Himanshu Soni, who is the lead actor in 'Aggar Tum Na Hote', has continued shooting for the serial despite suffering a back injury on the set. "I have in fact been advised bed rest for two months, but as the main character...I know how important it is for me to be present for each scene," he added.

392.title: Made mistakes in past, but learning every day: Pant on Player of Series win
392.article_body:
On being asked which aspect of his game (batting or wicketkeeping) satisfies him more, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant said, "Both of them...because, as a cricketer, you want to evolve." He added, "I've made a few mistakes in the past, but I'm learning each and every day."
Pant was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India-Sri Lanka two-match Test series.

393.title: Irish Aviation Authority revokes permits of Russian-operated planes
393.article_body: Irish Aviation Authority on Monday revoked certificates of airworthiness for all Russian-operated planes registered in the country amid the war between Russia and Ukraine. Reportedly, no plane is allowed to fly without the certificate. This comes after Bermuda Civil Aviation Authority also suspended certification of all Russian-operated planes on March 12 amid international sanctions over the war.

394.title: Moscow mayor ends requirement to use protective masks from March 15
394.article_body: Moscow mayor Sergei Sobyanin on Monday ended the requirement to use protective masks in public starting Tuesday, March 15. Citing improving COVID-19 situation in the Russian capital, Sobyanin added companies won't have to ensure anti-COVID-19 measures such as temperature checks and social distancing. Meanwhile the country reported 41,055 cases in last 24 hours with Moscow logging 957 infections.

395.title: 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' lovely film, Alia blessed with talent: Karthi
395.article_body: Tamil actor Karthi on Monday took to Twitter to appreciate Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' calling it a lovely film. He tweeted that actress Alia Bhatt is blessed with great talent, writing, "She erupts, melts and shines without losing the innocence." Karthi further wrote that the film is opulent and rich with aesthetics, adding that it is very special.

396.title: UK will continue supplying weapons to Ukraine: PM's spokesman
396.article_body: The UK will continue providing weapons to Ukraine, PM Boris Johnson's spokesman said on Monday. "We will absolutely carry on providing this...lethal capability to the Ukrainian government...We know it has been helpful," he added. The comments came after Russia launched missile strikes at a Ukrainian military base near Poland's border on Sunday, which the UK has termed "deeply concerning".

397.title: I wanted to show truth to whole world: Vivek on 'The Kashmir Files'
397.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri has said that he made the film because he wanted to show the truth to the whole world. "I wanted to make a sensitive film that has universal resonance," the filmmaker added. He further said he was inspired by Hollywood to make films that praise the country and present its greatness to the world.

398.title: He can send Putin to Jupiter: Ukraine Vice PM on 'Musk-Putin fight' tweet
398.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov while reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet calling for single combat with Russian President Vladimir Putin, wrote that the former can send Putin to Jupiter. Earlier today, the world's richest man Musk tweeted, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." Musk also tweeted to ask if Putin agreed to the fight.

399.title: AAP to contest 2023 panchayat polls in Bengal: State party in charge
399.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will contest the 2023 panchayat elections in West Bengal, state party in charge Sanjoy Basu confirmed on Monday. Basu added that the party has commenced its campaign in the state. Notably, AAP held a victory rally in Kolkata on Sunday to celebrate its win in the recently-concluded Punjab Assembly elections.

400.title: International kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal shot dead during tournament in Punjab
400.article_body: International kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal was shot dead on Monday by unidentified assailants during a kabaddi tournament in Malian village in Punjab's Jalandhar, police said. Around eight to 10 bullets were fired at him as per the police. As per reports, the bullets hit his head and chest.

401.title: Shreyas Iyer and Amelia Kerr named ICC Players of the Month for February
401.article_body: ICC today announced that India batter Shreyas Iyer and New Zealand Women all-rounder Amelia Kerr were voted ICC Players of the Month in men's and women's category respectively for February 2022. In February, Iyer had won Player of the Series award for scoring three unbeaten T20I fifties against Sri Lanka. Kerr had finished top-run scorer in ODI series against India.
